```{R}
library(readxl)
library(readr)

```

```{R}



# point towards directory
# point towards workbook THIS WILL CHANGE SOON!
drive <- "~/Desktop"
setwd(drive)
workbook <- "~/Desktop/workbooks/2011 AK Energy Statistics.xlsx"

# Read sheets and use for filenames
sheets <- excel_sheets(workbook)
filenames <- paste0(sheets, ".csv")

# read_excel only reads a single sheet, so lapply over each sheet name
dat <- lapply(sheets, read_excel, path = workbook)

# point towards location to save raw CSV files (sheets)
save_raw <- "~/repos/ak-energy-statistics-2011_2021/2011/raw/"
setwd(save_raw)

# I dream of idempotency..
# Save each data frame with different filename using write_csv
lapply(seq_along(dat), function(i) write_csv(dat[[i]], filenames[i]))




```


```{R}
setwd(save_raw)

i <- NULL
df <- NULL

for(i in filenames){
  assign(gsub(".csv", "", paste(i)), read.csv(paste(i)))
}






```

# Tables 2.5x below

## table 2.5a
### "Table 2.5a Revenue, Sales and Customers by Customer Type by Operators/Utilities ($000, MWh, Accounts), 2021"
```{R}
# extract title, use for idempotency below
title_2.5a <- `Table 2.5a`[6,1]
print(title_2.5a)

# use table title as qualifyer for cleaning expression
if(`Table 2.5a`[6,1] == "UtilityName") {
  
  # save second row as column names
  colnames(`Table 2.5a`) <- `Table 2.5a`[6, ]
  
  # add "residential" to some colnames
  b <- c(3,4,5,6)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5a`)[print(i)] <- paste("Residential", `Table 2.5a`[6,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # add "commercial" to some colnames
  b <- c(7,8,9,10)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5a`)[print(i)] <- paste("Commercial", `Table 2.5a`[6,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # add "commercial" to some colnames
  b <- c(11,12,13,14)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5a`)[print(i)] <- paste("Other", `Table 2.5a`[6,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # add "commercial" to some colnames
  b <- c(15,16,17,18)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5a`)[print(i)] <- paste("Total", `Table 2.5a`[6,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # delete first couple of rows
  `Table 2.5a` <- `Table 2.5a`[-c(1:6), ]

}

setwd(save_staging)
write.csv(`Table 2.5a`, file = "./table_2.5a.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```



## table 2.5b
### "Table 2.5b  Average Annual Energy Use and Rates by Customer Type by Operators/Utilities, (kWh/Customer, $/Customer, $/kWh), 2021"
```{R}
# save title, use to prevent repeat of cleaning expression
title_2.5b <- `Table 2.5b`[5,1]
print(title_2.5b)

if(`Table 2.5b`[5,1] == "UtilityName"){
  # save second row as column names
  colnames(`Table 2.5b`) <- `Table 2.5b`[5, ]
  
  # add "residential" to some colnames
  b <- c(3,4,5)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5b`)[print(i)] <- paste("Residential", `Table 2.5b`[5,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # add "commercial" to some colnames
  b <- c(6,7,8)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5b`)[print(i)] <- paste("Commercial", `Table 2.5b`[5,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  # add "other" to some colnames
  b <- c(9,10,11)
  for (i in b){
    colnames(`Table 2.5b`)[print(i)] <- paste("Other", `Table 2.5b`[5,print(i)], sep = " ")
  }
  
  
  # delete first couple of rows
  `Table 2.5b` <- `Table 2.5b`[-c(1:5), ]

}

setwd(save_staging)
write.csv(`Table 2.5b`, file = "./table_2.5b.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```


## table 2.5c
### "Table 2.5c  Average Residential Rates and PCE Payments ($/kWh), 2021"
```{R}
# save title
title_2.5c <- `Table 2.5c`[2,1]
print(title_2.5c)

if(`Table 2.5c`[2,1] == "Utility Name"){
  # save third row as column names
  colnames(`Table 2.5c`) <- `Table 2.5c`[2, ]
  
  # delete first row (title), second row (blank), and third row (column names)
  `Table 2.5c` <- `Table 2.5c`[-c(1:2), ]
}

setwd(save_staging)
write.csv(`Table 2.5c`, file = "./table_2.5c.csv", row.names = FALSE)
```
